# binconv
Handy tool to convert between binary and text

## Building

```sh
mvn clean package
```

*binconv.jar* will be generated within *target* directory.

## Usage

```sh
java -jar binconv.jar -<MODE> [SRC] -i <SRC_FILE_PATH> -o <DEST_FILE_PATH> [-newline <NEWLINE_POS>]
```
MODE: frombase64|tobase64|fromhex|tohex|frombin|tobin

## Example
### Base64
From Base64 text file to binary file

```sh
java -jar binconv.jar -frombase64 -i base64.txt -o image.jpg
```

From binary file to Base64 text file

```sh
java -jar binconv.jar -tobase64 -i image.jpg -o base64.txt
```

base64.txt


image.jpg

![ggb100x75](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12748956/167845734-91835738-ef64-4996-b16e-fff4a86009f2.jpg)

### Hex

From text file to binary file

```sh
java -jar binconv.jar -fromhex -i hex.txt -o image.jpg
```

From binary file to text file

```sh
java -jar binconv.jar -tohex -i image.jpg -o hex.txt
```

hex.txt

### Bin

From text file to binary file

```sh
java -jar binconv.jar -frombin -i bin.txt -o image.jpg
```

From binary file to text file

```sh
java -jar binconv.jar -tobin -i image.jpg -o bin.txt
```

bin.txt

```

```

In this way, it can also be used as a binary editor.
